batch_interactions.request:
Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /cakes resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Cakes
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cakes
   Description: Retrieve a list of available cakes with images and descriptions
   Used by pages: Home Page, Menu Page, Inventory Management Page
2. Endpoint: Search Cakes
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cakes/search
   Description: Search for cakes based on user input
   Used by pages: Home Page, Menu Page, Inventory Management Page
3. Endpoint: Get Cake Details
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cakes/{cakeId}
   Description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific cake
   Used by pages: Home Page, Menu Page, Inventory Management Page
4. Endpoint: Filter Cakes
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cakes/filter
   Description: Filter cakes by price, flavor, or popularity
   Used by pages: Menu Page, Inventory Management Page
5. Endpoint: Get Paginated Cakes
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cakes/page/{pageNumber}
   Description: Retrieve a paginated list of cakes
   Used by pages: Menu Page
6. Endpoint: Add Cake to Inventory
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/cakes
   Description: Add a new cake to the inventory
   Used by pages: Inventory Management Page
7. Endpoint: Remove Cake from Inventory
   Method: DELETE
   Path: /api/cakes/{cakeId}
   Description: Remove a cake from the inventory
   Used by pages: Inventory Management Page
8. Endpoint: Update Cake Quantity
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/cakes/{cakeId}/quantity
   Description: Update the quantity of a specific cake in the inventory
   Used by pages: Inventory Management Page
9. Endpoint: Update Cake Details
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/cakes/{cakeId}
   Description: Update the details of a specific cake, including description, price, and customization options
   Used by pages: Inventory Management Page
10. Endpoint: Get Low Stock Cakes
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cakes/low-stock
   Description: Retrieve a list of cakes with limited availability
   Used by pages: Inventory Management Page
11. Endpoint: Update Cake Availability
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/cakes/{cakeId}/availability
   Description: Update the availability of a specific cake (e.g. mark as 'out of stock' or 'available')
   Used by pages: Inventory Management Page

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /orders resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Create Order
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/orders
   Description: Create a new order with cake customization options
   Used by pages: Home Page
2. Endpoint: Get Pickup and Delivery Options
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/options
   Description: Retrieve available pickup and delivery options with associated costs and estimated times
   Used by pages: Home Page
3. Endpoint: Process Payment
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}/payment
   Description: Process payment for an order using a dummy payment gateway
   Used by pages: Home Page
4. Endpoint: Get Order Summary
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/summary
   Description: Retrieve order summary including cake details, pickup/delivery options, and total cost
   Used by pages: Payment Page
5. Endpoint: Get Order Details
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}
   Description: Retrieve order summary, including cake details, customization options, and quantity
   Used by pages: Order Confirmation Page, Account Dashboard, Order History Page
6. Endpoint: Get Order Pickup or Delivery Details
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}/pickup-delivery
   Description: Retrieve pickup or delivery details, including date, time, and location
   Used by pages: Order Confirmation Page
7. Endpoint: Get Order Payment Details
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}/payment
   Description: Retrieve order total, payment method, and payment status
   Used by pages: Order Confirmation Page
8. Endpoint: Get Order Confirmation Number
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}/confirmation-number
   Description: Retrieve unique order confirmation number
   Used by pages: Order Confirmation Page
9. Endpoint: Generate Receipt
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}/receipt
   Description: Generate receipt for the order
   Used by pages: Order Confirmation Page
10. Endpoint: Get Order History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders
   Description: Retrieve user's order history with order details
   Used by pages: Account Dashboard, Order History Page
11. Endpoint: Search Orders
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/search
   Description: Search orders by date, order status, or cake type
   Used by pages: Account Dashboard, Order History Page
12. Endpoint: Re-order Cake
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/orders/{orderId}/reorder
   Description: Re-order a previous cake
   Used by pages: Account Dashboard
13. Endpoint: Get Recent Orders
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/recent
   Description: Retrieve a summary of user's recent orders
   Used by pages: Account Dashboard
14. Endpoint: Filter Orders
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/orders/filter
   Description: Filter orders by date range or order status
   Used by pages: Order History Page

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:

  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 2", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 2"},
  ...
]

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /users resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Create Account
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/users
   Description: Create a new user account
   Used by pages: Home Page
2. Endpoint: Login
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/users/login
   Description: Login to an existing user account
   Used by pages: Home Page
3. Endpoint: Get Order History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/users/{userId}/orders
   Description: Retrieve a list of orders for a logged-in user
   Used by pages: Home Page
4. Endpoint: Save Payment Information
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/users/payment-info
   Description: Save payment information for future orders (if user is logged in)
   Used by pages: Payment Page
5. Endpoint: Get Order History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/users/{userId}/order-history
   Description: Retrieve order history for logged-in users
   Used by pages: Order Confirmation Page

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /cart resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Add Cake to Cart
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/cart
   Description: Add a cake to the user's cart
   Used by pages: Menu Page
2. Endpoint: Get Cart
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cart
   Description: Retrieve the user's cart contents
   Used by pages: Menu Page
3. Endpoint: Get Cart Items
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cart/items
   Description: Retrieve a list of selected cakes with their details
   Used by pages: Cart Page
4. Endpoint: Update Cart Item Quantity
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/cart/items/{itemId}/quantity
   Description: Update the quantity of a cake in the cart
   Used by pages: Cart Page
5. Endpoint: Remove Cart Item
   Method: DELETE
   Path: /api/cart/items/{itemId}
   Description: Remove a cake from the cart
   Used by pages: Cart Page
6. Endpoint: Get Total Cost
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cart/total-cost
   Description: Calculate the total cost of all cakes in the cart, including taxes and discounts
   Used by pages: Cart Page
7. Endpoint: Get Pickup and Delivery Options
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cart/pickup-delivery-options
   Description: Retrieve available pickup and delivery options with estimated costs and time frames
   Used by pages: Cart Page
8. Endpoint: Apply Promo Code
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/cart/promo-code
   Description: Apply a promo code or discount to the cart
   Used by pages: Cart Page
9. Endpoint: Get Order Summary
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/cart/order-summary
   Description: Retrieve a summary of the order, including cakes, pickup/delivery options, and payment method
   Used by pages: Cart Page
10. Endpoint: Proceed to Checkout
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/cart/checkout
   Description: Initiate the checkout process
   Used by pages: Cart Page
11. Endpoint: Process Payment
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/cart/payment
   Description: Process online payment through a payment gateway
   Used by pages: Cart Page
12. Endpoint: Validate Payment
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/cart/payment/validate
   Description: Validate user input and handle any errors during the checkout process
   Used by pages: Cart Page

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /checkout resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Pickup and Delivery Options
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/checkout/options
   Description: Retrieve available pickup and delivery options with corresponding addresses and time slots
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
2. Endpoint: Get Payment Method Options
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/checkout/payment-methods
   Description: Retrieve available payment method options
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
3. Endpoint: Create Order
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/checkout/orders
   Description: Create a new order with selected pickup or delivery option and payment details
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
4. Endpoint: Validate Payment Details
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/checkout/payment-details/validate
   Description: Validate payment details such as card number, expiration date, and CVV
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
5. Endpoint: Process Payment
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/checkout/payment/process
   Description: Process payment using a dummy payment gateway for testing purposes
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
6. Endpoint: Get Order Summary
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/checkout/orders/summary
   Description: Retrieve order summary, including cake details, pickup/delivery option, and total cost
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
7. Endpoint: Update Order Status
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/checkout/orders/status
   Description: Update order status in the restaurant's existing POS system and inventory management
   Used by pages: Checkout Page
8. Endpoint: Calculate Taxes and Fees
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/checkout/orders/calculate-taxes
   Description: Calculate applicable taxes, fees, or discounts for an order
   Used by pages: Checkout Page

Return a JSON array with specifications for each endpoint in order:
[
  {"request_body": "describe parameters/body for endpoint 1", "response": "describe response structure for endpoint 1"},

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /payments resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Process Payment
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/payments
   Description: Submit payment information to the dummy payment gateway
   Used by pages: Payment Page
2. Endpoint: Verify Payment
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/payments/verify
   Description: Verify payment status after submission
   Used by pages: Payment Page

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /auth resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Login
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/login
   Description: Login to an existing account during the payment process
   Used by pages: Payment Page, Login Page
2. Endpoint: Create Account
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/register
   Description: Create a new account during the payment process
   Used by pages: Payment Page, Login Page
3. Endpoint: Forgot Password
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/forgot-password
   Description: Send password reset link to user
   Used by pages: Login Page
4. Endpoint: Validate Credentials
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/validate-credentials
   Description: Check if username and password are valid
   Used by pages: Login Page
5. Endpoint: Save Login Credentials
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/auth/save-credentials
   Description: Save user login credentials for remember me feature
   Used by pages: Login Page
6. Endpoint: Clear Login Credentials
   Method: DELETE
   Path: /api/auth/clear-credentials
   Description: Clear saved user login credentials
   Used by pages: Login Page

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /registration resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Registration Form
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/registration/form
   Description: Returns the registration form with fields for username, email, password, and confirm password
   Used by pages: Registration Page
2. Endpoint: Validate Registration Form
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/registration/validate
   Description: Validates the registration form data, including email format and password strength
   Used by pages: Registration Page
3. Endpoint: Check Username Availability
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/registration/username/:username
   Description: Checks if a username is available and not already in use
   Used by pages: Registration Page
4. Endpoint: Check Email Availability
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/registration/email/:email
   Description: Checks if an email is available and not already in use
   Used by pages: Registration Page
5. Endpoint: Create New User
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/registration
   Description: Creates a new user account with the provided registration form data
   Used by pages: Registration Page

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /admin resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Sales Metrics
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/sales-metrics
   Description: Retrieve overall sales and revenue metrics
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
2. Endpoint: Get Orders
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/orders
   Description: List all current and pending orders with order status
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
3. Endpoint: Search Orders
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/orders/search
   Description: Find specific orders by customer name, order ID, or date
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
4. Endpoint: Update Order Status
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/admin/orders/{orderId}
   Description: Update order status and add notes to orders
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
5. Endpoint: Get Calendar View
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/calendar
   Description: Display a calendar view of upcoming orders and pickups
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
6. Endpoint: Get Low-Stock Alerts
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/low-stock-alerts
   Description: Show low-stock alerts for cake ingredients and decorations
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
7. Endpoint: Get Cake Menu Items
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/cake-menu-items
   Description: Retrieve cake menu items
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
8. Endpoint: Add Cake Menu Item
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/admin/cake-menu-items
   Description: Add a new cake menu item
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
9. Endpoint: Update Cake Menu Item
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/admin/cake-menu-items/{menuItemId}
   Description: Update an existing cake menu item
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
10. Endpoint: Delete Cake Menu Item
   Method: DELETE
   Path: /api/admin/cake-menu-items/{menuItemId}
   Description: Remove a cake menu item
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
11. Endpoint: Get Customer Accounts
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/customers
   Description: Retrieve customer accounts and order history
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
12. Endpoint: Get Customer Order History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/customers/{customerId}/order-history
   Description: Retrieve order history for a specific customer
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
13. Endpoint: Get Payment Metrics
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/payment-metrics
   Description: Retrieve payment processing metrics
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
14. Endpoint: Get Restaurant Settings
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/admin/restaurant-settings
   Description: Retrieve restaurant settings
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
15. Endpoint: Update Restaurant Settings
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/admin/restaurant-settings
   Description: Update restaurant settings
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard
16. Endpoint: Integrate with POS System
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/admin/integrate-pos-system
   Description: Integrate with POS system to automatically update inventory levels
   Used by pages: Admin Dashboard

JSON array only:

Create full API specifications for ALL endpoints in the /pos resource.

Application Context: The website will be an online platform for an existing restaurant to take cake orders from customers. Customers will be able to browse a menu of available cakes, customize cakes with different flavors, designs, and messages, specify pickup or delivery options, and make payments online.

Endpoints to specify:

1. Endpoint: Get Available POS Systems
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/pos/systems
   Description: Returns a list of available POS systems for integration
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
2. Endpoint: Connect to POS System
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/pos/connect
   Description: Connects to a POS system using the provided API key or credentials
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
3. Endpoint: Disconnect from POS System
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/pos/disconnect
   Description: Disconnects from the currently connected POS system
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
4. Endpoint: Get POS System Integration Status
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/pos/status
   Description: Returns the current integration status and connection history of the POS system
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
5. Endpoint: Update Cake Inventory
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/pos/inventory
   Description: Updates the cake inventory in the website based on the POS system data
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
6. Endpoint: Override POS System Data
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/pos/override
   Description: Manually overrides the POS system data for cake inventory or availability
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
7. Endpoint: Get POS System Connection History
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/pos/history
   Description: Returns the connection history of the POS system
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
8. Endpoint: Handle POS System Error
   Method: POST
   Path: /api/pos/error
   Description: Handles errors that occur during POS system integration or synchronization
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
9. Endpoint: Get POS System Credentials
   Method: GET
   Path: /api/pos/credentials
   Description: Returns the credentials of the currently connected POS system
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page
10. Endpoint: Update POS System Credentials
   Method: PUT
   Path: /api/pos/credentials
   Description: Updates the credentials of the currently connected POS system
   Used by pages: POS Integration Page

JSON array only:

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of available cakes with images and descriptions
endpoints.page_context: Home Page, Menu Page, Inventory Management Page

endpoints.description: Search for cakes based on user input
endpoints.page_context: Home Page, Menu Page, Inventory Management Page

endpoints.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific cake
endpoints.page_context: Home Page, Menu Page, Inventory Management Page

endpoints.description: Create a new order with cake customization options
Retrieve available pickup and delivery options with associated costs and estimated times
Process payment for an order using a dummy payment gateway
Create a new user account
Login to an existing user account
Retrieve a list of orders for a logged-in user
Retrieve restaurant logo and contact information
Filter cakes by price, flavor, or popularity
Retrieve a list of cake categories or sub-categories
endpoints.request_body: None. This endpoint does not require any parameters or request body.
endpoints.response: A JSON array of cake category objects. Each object contains the category id, name, and description. Example: [{id: 1, name: 'Birthday Cakes', description: 'Cakes for birthday celebrations'}, {id: 2, name: 'Wedding Cakes', description: 'Cakes for wedding celebrations'}]

endpoints.description: Add a cake to the user's cart

request_body.cakeId: integer, the ID of the cake to add
request_body.quantity: integer, the quantity of the cake to add

customizations.flavor: string, the flavor of the cake
customizations.design: string, the design of the cake
customizations.message: string, the message on the cake

response.cartId: integer, the ID of the cart

cartItems.cakeId: integer, the ID of the cake
cartItems.quantity: integer, the quantity of the cake

customizations.flavor: string, the flavor of the cake
customizations.design: string, the design of the cake
customizations.message: string, the message on the cake

endpoints.description: Retrieve the user's cart contents

response.cartId: integer, the ID of the cart

cartItems.cakeId: integer, the ID of the cake
cartItems.quantity: integer, the quantity of the cake

customizations.flavor: string, the flavor of the cake
customizations.design: string, the design of the cake
customizations.message: string, the message on the cake

endpoints.description: Create a new user account
Login to an existing user account

request_body.username: string, required, the username of the user
request_body.password: string, required, the password of the user

response.token: string, the authentication token for the user
response.user_id: integer, the ID of the user
response.error: string, error message if login fails

endpoints.description: Retrieve a paginated list of cakes
Retrieve a list of available cake options with images and descriptions
endpoints.request_body: None. No parameters or body required for this endpoint.
endpoints.response: A JSON array of cake option objects. Each object contains: id (unique identifier), name, description, image_url, price, flavors (array of available flavors), designs (array of available designs), and sizes (array of available sizes). Example: [{id: 1, name: 'Chocolate Cake', description: 'Moist chocolate cake', image_url: 'https://example.com/chocolate-cake.jpg', price: 40.00, flavors: ['chocolate', 'vanilla'], designs: ['round', 'square'], sizes: ['6-inch', '8-inch']}]

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of available cake flavors
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON array of cake flavor objects, each containing 'id' (unique identifier), 'name' (flavor name), and 'description' (brief description of the flavor)

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of available cake designs
endpoints.request_body: None. No parameters or body required for this GET request.
endpoints.response: A JSON array of cake design objects. Each object contains the design ID, name, description, image URL, and price. Example: [{id: 1, name: 'Buttercream', description: 'Classic buttercream design', imageUrl: 'https://example.com/buttercream.jpg', price: 50.0}, {id: 2, name: 'Fondant', description: 'Smooth fondant design', imageUrl: 'https://example.com/fondant.jpg', price: 60.0}]

endpoints.description: Create a customized cake with chosen options

request_body.delivery_address: object (required if pickup_or_delivery is delivery, containing street, city, state, zip)
request_body.payment_method: string (required, e.g. credit card, paypal, etc.)

response.custom_cake_id: integer (unique identifier for the custom cake)
response.total_cost: decimal (total cost of the custom cake)

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of available pickup options
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required for this endpoint
endpoints.response: JSON array of pickup options, each option containing: id (unique identifier), name (pickup option name), description (pickup option description), availability (array of available dates and times), address (pickup location address)

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of available delivery options
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required

data.id: integer, unique identifier for the delivery option
data.name: string, name of the delivery option (e.g. 'Standard Delivery', 'Express Delivery')
data.description: string, brief description of the delivery option
data.price: number, price of the delivery option
data.estimated_delivery_time: string, estimated time of delivery (e.g. '2-3 business days')
data.available_areas: array of strings, areas where the delivery option is available

endpoints.description: Validate a user's input address for delivery

request_body.address_line_1: string, required, the first line of the address
request_body.address_line_2: string, optional, the second line of the address
request_body.city: string, required, the city of the address
request_body.state: string, required, the state of the address
request_body.zip_code: string, required, the zip code of the address
request_body.country: string, required, the country of the address

response.is_valid: boolean, whether the address is valid for delivery
response.error_message: string, optional, an error message if the address is not valid
response.suggested_address: object, optional, a suggested address if the input address is not valid
response.delivery_estimate: string, optional, an estimated delivery time or date if the address is valid

endpoints.description: Calculate the total cost of the customized cake

request_body.delivery_address: object (optional, with properties: street, city, state, zip)

endpoints.description: Add the customized cake to the user's cart

request_body.cake_id: integer, the ID of the cake to be added to cart
request_body.flavor_id: integer, the ID of the flavor chosen for the cake
request_body.design_id: integer, the ID of the design chosen for the cake
request_body.message: string, the message to be written on the cake
request_body.quantity: integer, the number of cakes to be ordered

response.cart_id: integer, the ID of the cart
response.cake_id: integer, the ID of the cake added to cart
response.flavor_id: integer, the ID of the flavor chosen for the cake
response.design_id: integer, the ID of the design chosen for the cake
response.message: string, the message to be written on the cake
response.quantity: integer, the number of cakes ordered
response.total_cost: float, the total cost of the cake

endpoints.description: Proceed to payment for the customized cake

request_body.payment_method: string, payment method (e.g. credit card, paypal)

response.payment_url: string, URL to redirect to for payment
response.total_cost: float, total cost of the order

endpoints.description: Process payment for the customized cake

request_body.cake_id: integer, unique identifier for the cake
request_body.payment_method: string, payment method used (e.g. credit card, paypal)
request_body.pickup_or_delivery: string, pickup or delivery option chosen by customer
request_body.pickup_time: string, pickup time chosen by customer
request_body.total_cost: float, total cost of the cake

response.payment_status: string, status of the payment (e.g. success, failed)
response.transaction_id: string, unique identifier for the transaction
response.order_id: integer, unique identifier for the order

endpoints.description: Create a new user account

request_body.username: string, required, unique username chosen by the user
request_body.email: string, required, unique email address of the user
request_body.password: string, required, password for the user account
request_body.first_name: string, optional, first name of the user
request_body.last_name: string, optional, last name of the user

response.user_id: integer, unique identifier for the newly created user account
response.username: string, username chosen by the user
response.email: string, email address of the user
response.token: string, authentication token for the user

endpoints.description: Retrieve a user's order history
endpoints.request_body: No request body. Query parameters: userId (integer, required), pageNumber (integer, optional, default=1), pageSize (integer, optional, default=10)
endpoints.response: JSON array of order history objects. Each object contains: orderId (integer), orderDate (string, ISO 8601 format), orderTotal (decimal), orderStatus (string), cakeDetails (object with cakeId, cakeName, cakeDescription, cakePrice), customizationDetails (object with flavor, design, message), pickupOrDelivery (string), paymentMethod (string)

endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of selected cakes with their details

cartItems.itemId: integer, the ID of the cart item
cartItems.cakeId: integer, the ID of the cake
cartItems.quantity: integer, the quantity of the cake

customizations.flavor: string, the flavor of the cake
customizations.design: string, the design of the cake
customizations.message: string, the message on the cake

cartItems.price: decimal, the price of the cake

endpoints.description: Update the quantity of a cake in the cart

request_body.quantity: integer, the new quantity of the cake

response.itemId: integer, the ID of the cart item
response.quantity: integer, the new quantity of the cake

endpoints.description: Remove a cake from the cart
Calculate the total cost of all cakes in the cart, including taxes and discounts

response.totalCost: decimal, the total cost of the cart
response.subTotal: decimal, the subtotal of the cart

endpoints.description: Retrieve available pickup and delivery options with estimated costs and time frames

pickupOptions.optionId: integer, the ID of the pickup option
pickupOptions.description: string, the description of the pickup option
pickupOptions.cost: decimal, the cost of the pickup option
pickupOptions.timeFrame: string, the time frame of the pickup option

deliveryOptions.optionId: integer, the ID of the delivery option
deliveryOptions.description: string, the description of the delivery option
deliveryOptions.cost: decimal, the cost of the delivery option
deliveryOptions.timeFrame: string, the time frame of the delivery option

endpoints.description: Apply a promo code or discount to the cart

request_body.promoCode: string, the promo code to apply

endpoints.description: Retrieve a summary of the order, including cakes, pickup/delivery options, and payment method

cartItems.cakeId: integer, the ID of the cake
cartItems.quantity: integer, the quantity of the cake

customizations.flavor: string, the flavor of the cake
customizations.design: string, the design of the cake
customizations.message: string, the message on the cake

pickupDeliveryOption.optionId: integer, the ID of the pickup or delivery option
pickupDeliveryOption.description: string, the description of the pickup or delivery option

endpoints.description: Initiate the checkout process

response.orderId: integer, the ID of the order

cartItems.cakeId: integer, the ID of the cake
cartItems.quantity: integer, the quantity of the cake

customizations.flavor: string, the flavor of the cake
customizations.design: string, the design of the cake
customizations.message: string, the message on the cake

pickupDeliveryOption.optionId: integer, the ID of the pickup or delivery option
pickupDeliveryOption.description: string, the description of the pickup or delivery option

endpoints.description: Process online payment through a payment gateway

response.orderId: integer, the ID of the order

endpoints.description: Validate user input and handle any errors during the checkout process

errors.field: string, the field with the error

endpoints.description: Retrieve available pickup and delivery options with corresponding addresses and time slots
Retrieve available payment method options
Create a new order with selected pickup or delivery option and payment details
Validate payment details such as card number, expiration date, and CVV
Process payment using a dummy payment gateway for testing purposes
Retrieve order summary, including cake details, pickup/delivery option, and total cost
Update order status in the restaurant's existing POS system and inventory management
Create a new customer account
Login an existing customer to view order history
Retrieve order history for a logged-in customer
Calculate applicable taxes, fees, or discounts for an order
Retrieve available payment method options
endpoints.request_body: None. This endpoint does not require any parameters or request body.
endpoints.response: A JSON array of available payment methods. Each payment method object contains 'id' (unique identifier), 'name' (e.g., 'Credit Card', 'PayPal'), and 'description' (brief description of the payment method). Example: [{"id": 1, "name": "Credit Card", "description": "Pay using your credit card"}, {"id": 2, "name": "PayPal", "description": "Pay using your PayPal account"}]

endpoints.description: Retrieve order summary including cake details, pickup/delivery options, and total cost
Submit payment information to the dummy payment gateway

request_body.card_number: string (if payment method is credit card)
request_body.expiration_date: string (if payment method is credit card, in MM/YY format)
request_body.cvv: string (if payment method is credit card)

endpoints.description: Save payment information for future orders (if user is logged in)
Login to an existing account during the payment process
Create a new account during the payment process
Verify payment status after submission
Retrieve order summary, including cake details, customization options, and quantity
endpoints.page_context: Order Confirmation Page, Account Dashboard, Order History Page

endpoints.endpoint_name: Get Order Pickup or Delivery Details
endpoints.description: Retrieve pickup or delivery details, including date, time, and location
Retrieve order total, payment method, and payment status
Retrieve unique order confirmation number
Retrieve order history for logged-in users
Generate receipt for the order
Retrieve restaurant's contact information, including phone number and email address
Retrieve restaurant's social media links

response.facebook: string (URL of the restaurant's Facebook page)
response.instagram: string (URL of the restaurant's Instagram page)
response.twitter: string (URL of the restaurant's Twitter page)

endpoints.description: Send password reset link to user
Check if username and password are valid

response.is_valid: boolean, true if credentials are valid

endpoints.description: Save user login credentials for remember me feature
Clear saved user login credentials
Returns the registration form with fields for username, email, password, and confirm password
Validates the registration form data, including email format and password strength

fields.name: valid
fields.description: Whether the registration form data is valid

fields.name: errors
fields.description: Error messages for each invalid field

endpoints.description: Checks if a username is available and not already in use

fields.name: message
fields.description: Message indicating whether the username is available or not

endpoints.description: Checks if an email is available and not already in use

fields.name: message
fields.description: Message indicating whether the email is available or not

endpoints.description: Creates a new user account with the provided registration form data

fields.name: userId
fields.description: The ID of the newly created user

fields.name: message
fields.description: Message indicating that the user was created successfully

endpoints.description: Returns the terms and conditions page content
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required

content.terms_and_conditions: string, the content of the terms and conditions page

endpoints.description: Redirects to the login page

response.redirect_url: string, the URL of the login page
response.status_code: integer, the HTTP status code for the redirect (e.g. 302)

endpoints.description: Retrieve user's account information
Retrieve user's order history with order details
Search orders by date, order status, or cake type
Re-order a previous cake
Retrieve user's loyalty or reward points
Update user's account information
Update user's password
Logout user from the system
endpoints.request_body: The request body for this endpoint should contain no parameters. It is used to invalidate the current user's session, effectively logging them out of the system.
endpoints.response: The response should be a JSON object with a boolean 'success' property indicating whether the logout was successful, and a 'message' property with a corresponding message. For example: { 'success': true, 'message': 'User logged out successfully' }

endpoints.description: Retrieve a summary of user's recent orders
Filter orders by date range or order status
Retrieve the customer's name and contact information
Retrieve overall sales and revenue metrics
List all current and pending orders with order status
Find specific orders by customer name, order ID, or date
Update order status and add notes to orders
Display a calendar view of upcoming orders and pickups
Show low-stock alerts for cake ingredients and decorations
Retrieve cake menu items
Add a new cake menu item
Update an existing cake menu item
Remove a cake menu item
Retrieve customer accounts and order history
Retrieve order history for a specific customer
Retrieve payment processing metrics
Retrieve restaurant settings
Update restaurant settings
Integrate with POS system to automatically update inventory levels
Returns a list of available POS systems for integration
Connects to a POS system using the provided API key or credentials
Disconnects from the currently connected POS system
Returns the current integration status and connection history of the POS system
Updates the cake inventory in the website based on the POS system data
Manually overrides the POS system data for cake inventory or availability
Returns the connection history of the POS system
Handles errors that occur during POS system integration or synchronization
Returns the credentials of the currently connected POS system
Updates the credentials of the currently connected POS system
Add a new cake to the inventory
Remove a cake from the inventory
Update the quantity of a specific cake in the inventory
Update the details of a specific cake, including description, price, and customization options
Retrieve a list of cakes with limited availability
Update the availability of a specific cake (e.g. mark as 'out of stock' or 'available')
Retrieve overall inventory levels and statistics
Generate a report on cake sales
endpoints.request_body: None, query parameters: date_range (optional, format: YYYY-MM-DD - YYYY-MM-DD), cake_type (optional, e.g. birthday, wedding, etc.)
endpoints.response: JSON object with sales report data: {total_sales: float, sales_by_cake_type: {cake_type: string, sales: float}[], sales_by_date: {date: string, sales: float}[]}

endpoints.description: Generate a report on inventory levels
endpoints.request_body: None, query parameters: ingredient (optional, e.g. flour, sugar, etc.), supplier (optional, e.g. name of supplier)
endpoints.response: JSON object with inventory report data: {total_inventory: float, inventory_by_ingredient: {ingredient: string, quantity: float}[], inventory_by_supplier: {supplier: string, quantity: float}[]}

endpoints.description: Retrieve contact information, including phone number, email, and physical address
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required

endpoints.description: Retrieve business hours
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or request body required
endpoints.response: JSON object containing business hours, e.g. {"monday": {"open": "9:00 AM", "close": "6:00 PM"}, "tuesday": {"open": "9:00 AM", "close": "6:00 PM"}, ...}

endpoints.description: Retrieve social media profiles
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON array of social media profiles, each containing 'id', 'platform' (e.g. Facebook, Instagram, Twitter), 'handle', and 'url' properties

endpoints.description: Retrieve FAQ section for common inquiries
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or request body required
endpoints.response: JSON array of FAQ objects, each containing 'id', 'question', and 'answer' properties, e.g. [{"id": 1, "question": "What is the order cutoff time?", "answer": "Orders must be placed by 5pm for next day pickup"}, ...]

endpoints.description: Submit contact form with fields for name, email, and message

response.message: string, e.g. 'Contact form submitted successfully' or 'Error submitting contact form'
response.data: object, optional, additional data related to the submission

endpoints.description: Upload files or images for custom cake inquiries

request_body.description: The request body should be a multipart/form-data object containing a file or image.

parameters.file: The file or image to be uploaded.

response.description: A JSON object containing the uploaded file's metadata.

structure.filename: The name of the uploaded file.
structure.filetype: The type of the uploaded file.
structure.filesize: The size of the uploaded file in bytes.
structure.fileurl: The URL of the uploaded file.

endpoints.description: Retrieve restaurant location to display on map
endpoints.request_body: None, no parameters or body required
endpoints.response: JSON object with restaurant location details, e.g. { latitude: float, longitude: float, address: string, city: string, state: string, zip: string, country: string }
